attributes.action: Right to suspend a child contact order impacting a child's education & wellbeing
attributes.additional_details:
Contact orders give perpetrators a legal right to continue contact making it extremely challenging for the victim to safe guard the child. 
I did not have the power to immediately protect my child despite having evidence from services & school that the current arrangement was having a detrimental impact on the child's wellbeing. School reports also showed the child was falling behind. 
Family Courts are to supposed to keep victims & children safe not give power to perpetrators.
attributes.background: Perpetrators continue to subject their victims to abuse through child contact which has been proved to impact a child's wellbeing & education. The victim, school or services should be given the legal right to suspend contact when there is evidence that the arrangement is having a detrimental impact.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about varying court orders about child arrangements are a matter for the courts, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You can find out more about changing a court order here: https://www.gov.uk/looking-after-children-divorce/change-or-enforce-an-order
